Instructions So here\'s how this works. Input your income and recurring \'expenses\' (savings, rent, student loans, etc). I strongly recommend putting money in savings to cover unpredicted expense (i.e. speeding tickets). The remainder is spending money for items of highly variable cost (i.e. food, gas, clothes, etc).
Say for instance you make $1227.12 every 2 weeks after taxes, you might input the following Income: $1200 every 2 weeks Save: $200 every 2 weeks Rent: $500 monthly Utilities: $120 monthly Loans: $400 monthly Gym Fee: $50 monthly Insurance: $550 bi-yearly
You can spend about $33 per day. (will be calculated for you)
So instead of getting your pay check and thinking \"now I have a bulk of money to spend!\" you will instead only allow yourself to spend $33 of it each day. This should help you keep a tight understanding of your finances and give you a better understanding of what things cost.
So let\'s get started!
